intro: Scleranthus pycnocarpus, commonly known as the dense-fruited thornweed, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release seeds when mature. Scleranthus pycnocarpus is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry, open habitats.
